item.title: RAG: Retrieval-Augmented Generation Explained
item.description: LLMs have a knowledge cutoff. They hallucinate. RAG fixes this: retrieve relevant documents first, then generate answer based on retrieved context.

item.title: BERT: Bidirectional Language Understanding
item.description: Before BERT: train models from scratch for each task. After BERT: pretrain once, fine-tune everywhere.

item.title: How Transformers Know Position: Positional Encoding
item.description: Self-attention is permutation equivariant. Shuffle the input tokens, output shuffles the same way.

item.title: FastText: When Words Aren't in Your Vocabulary
item.description: Word2Vec problem: what about misspellings? What about “unhappiness” when you only trained on “happy”?

item.title: GloVe: Global Vectors for Word Representation
item.description: Word2Vec uses local context windows. GloVe takes a different approach - use global word co-occurrence statistics.

item.title: Word2Vec: The Breakthrough in Word Embeddings
item.description: Before Word2Vec, representing words for ML was rough. One-hot encoding, TF-IDF… none of them captured meaning.

item.title: Embeddings: Turning Everything Into Vectors
item.description: Embeddings are everywhere now. Words, sentences, images, users, products… anything can be an embedding.

item.title: How Text Becomes Numbers: Tokenization Explained
item.description: ML models don’t read text. They need numbers. Tokenization bridges that gap.

item.title: Bag of Words: Still the Simplest Text Representation
item.description: Before embeddings there was Bag of Words. Still useful, still relevant for some tasks.

item.title: Cosine Similarity: Why Direction Matters More Than Magnitude
item.description: Two embeddings point in similar direction? They’re similar. Cosine similarity ignores magnitude, only cares about angle.

item.title: NLP: TF-IDF and Word2Vec
item.description: In this follow-up to our earlier post on N-Grams and Bag of Words, we’ll deconstruct two more fundamental Natural Language Processing (NLP) concepts: TF-IDF and Word2Vec.

item.title: NLP: N-Grams and bag of words
item.description: Welcome to this blog post where we’ll unravel the concepts of N-Grams and Bag of Words, fundamental notions for natural language processing tasks.
